metadata.Title: CVE-2016-7438 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Certified (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
The C software implementation of ECC in wolfSSL (formerly CyaSSL) before 3.9.10 makes it easier for local users to discover RSA keys by leveraging cache-bank hit differences.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-7438` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libwolfssl24 - 3.9.10+dfsg-1
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Gorka Irazoqui Apecechea and Xiaofei Guo

criterions.comment: wolfssl package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.9.10+dfsg-1').
